properties.name: Avalon Theatre and Nickel Arcade
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3451 SE Belmont St, PortlandStaff Picks: Best Place to Get Out of the Rain "Cheap movies, plus a huge arcade with lots of games. Good for all ages." - Kate The Avalon Theatre has two screens of mostly family-themed movies, and a Nickel Arcade. Movies range from .50 to for adults, depending on whether they\'re starred attractions or not. The Nickel Arcade is fun, but deceptive. The machines only take nickels... but that doesn\'t mean they only cost a nickel to play! Most of the machines are only slightly less expensive than games in a normal arcade. Caveat emptor!

properties.name: Bagdad Theater and Pub
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3702 SE Hawthorne, Portland OREnjoy a movie for , beer, and pizza in a Middle Eastern-themed movie house from the \'20s.

properties.name: Bread and Ink Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3610 SE Hawthorne Blvd, portlandStaff Picks: Breakfast "Delicious breakfasts, locally-inspired dishes, great for anyone whether you are omnivores or vegan!" - Emily

properties.name: Cricket Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3159 SE Belmont St, portlandStaff Picks: Breakfast "By far the most delicious breakfast in town. Very creative and diverse menu. Good for vegans, vegetarians and meat-eaters alike!" - Kate

properties.name: Cup & Saucer Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3566 SE Hawthorne Blvd, portlandStaff Picks: Breakfast "I can\'t help it -- I have always loved the Cup & Saucer and their World Famous Veggie Scramble. Nothing quite as filling -- especially if you are heading out in the cold and wet." - Talbot The Cup & Saucer is a trendy chain of local cafés, with locations of SE Hawthorne, NE Killingsworth and N Denver. If you\'re coming on a weekend in the morning or early afternoon, it might take a little while to get seated. In the summer there\'s a line waiting outside -- it\'s a popular place, and also good for people watching!

properties.name: Dot's Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2521 SE Clinton St,PortlandStaff Picks: Dinner Place "The food is pretty standard upscale tavern fare with numerous veggie selections. However, the atmosphere is somewhere between lite-goth and dark-retro. Funky, fun and a great hangout. Priceless velvet painting collection with a rare \'Dogs Playing Cards\' and an \'Old Fat Elvis.\'" - Drew

properties.name: Forest Park and the Witches Castle
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  Staff Picks: Favorite Place to be Outdoors "Forest Park is the largest urban forest in the U.S. It\'s like the forest moon of Endor. But my favorite part is the "Witches Castle," a ruined stone building along the trail. It\'s a stone restroom from the \'30s that was damaged in a storm in the 60s. It\'s absolutely gorgeous." - Brandon Forest Park stretches for more than eight miles, and the walking path in it is a 40 mile loop. The #15 bus from Belmont will drop you off near the Lower Macleay Park entrance, where these photos were taken. To get to the Witches Castle (also called the Stone House), walk the Lower Macleay Park trail for 20 minutes. The "Castle" is on your left, at a juncture with another trail.

properties.name: Genie's Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 1101 SE Division St portland, orStaff Picks: Breakfast "By far the best breakfast in town. Don\'t forget to top it off with the best Bloody Mary in town. Closes at 3 p.m. Expect a wait on weekends. It\'s that good." - Michele

properties.name: Greyhound Station
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel550 NW 6th Ave, portlandHere\'s how to get to the Hostel from Portland\'s Greyhound Station Walk one block west on NW Hoyt St to NW Broadway. Board Bus #9 (Powell), pay .70 and grab a bus transfer Get off at SW 3rd and Alder Cross SW 3rd and walk one block east to SW 2nd and Alder Use your transfer to take Bus #14 (Hawthorne to 94th and Foster) to SE 30th and Hawthorne, one stop past the Safeway on the right Get off at 30th, and walk across the street to 3031 SE Hawthorne (If you don\'t mind walking a 15 minute walk, you can skip bus #9 and just walk down to the 2nd and Alder stop for the #14.)

properties.name: Hawthorne Street Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3354 Southeast Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Breakfast "I very much like the smoked salmon eggs benedict and the homemade cream cheese spread at the Hawthorne Café." - Drew

properties.name: Ira Keller Fountain
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel Hot day? Cool off in Keller Fountain downtown! There\'s signs saying "Don\'t drink the water, it\'s treated" and "Be careful on slippery wet surfaces," but no signs saying "Don\'t swim." So everybody does.It\'s a free way to cool off downtown, it\'s scenic as all hell, and you\'re surrounded by the sound of waterfalls.

properties.name: Laughing Planet
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3320 SE Belmont St, Portland, ORStaff Picks: Dinner Place "Makes the most reasonably-priced and yummy burritos this side of the Willamette! Try the mole sauce." - Talbot (Also a great option for vegan and vegetarian food.)

properties.name: Laurelhurst Park
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  , , ORStaff Picks: Favorite Place to be Outdoors "Nice walk from the hostel (about 15 minutes), great place to go running, nice little pond. Lots of ducks, although you aren\'t supposed to feed them... but they are still cool to look at. Lots of trees and grassy areas to chill out on." - Kate

properties.name: Laurelhurst Theater
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  2735 east burnside st portland orStaff Picks: Best Place to Get Out of the Rain "Movies for #3, beer and pizza while you watch." - Emily Probably the best second-run movie theater in Portland, the Laurelhurst features four screens. You can buy microbrews, wine, Pizzicato pizza, in one of the first art deco buildings in the U.S., dating back to 1923. It\'s about a 15 minute walk north from the Hostel.

properties.name: MarchFourth Marching Band
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel534 se oak street portland, or 97214MarchFourth Marching Band is a 25-piece carabaret marching band, accompanied by 10 burlesque dancers and stilt walkers. They make their own costumes and drum harnesses (out of bike parts), and they put on one of the best shows you will ever see in this town. The marker on the map above is for their practice space, The Egg, an art warehouse they share with other local groups and individuals. To find out when and where they\'re playing, check out the link above.

properties.name: McCormick and Baxter Creosoting Co. Superfund Site
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel After McCormick and Baxter went bankrupt in 1991, their creosoting plant was turned over to the federal government, who made it a Superfund toxic waste clean-up site.

properties.name: Mojo's Coffee Den
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2816 Se Stark St, Portland, 97214Staff Picks: Favorite Coffee Shop "They use Stumptown coffee and have a real laid-back approach. People from all walks of life frequent Mojo\'s." - Talbot

properties.name: Movie Madness Video
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel   4320 SE Belmont Street, Portland, ORYour first time in Movie Madness, you WILL get lost. Movie Madness bills itself as "the best independent video store in the world," and we\'re inclined to believe them. More than 50,000 DVDs and video tapes, with vast selections of foreign and independent films. It also doubles as a museum, with props and costumes from famous movies on display. Knives from Psycho and Scream, the head of one of the aliens from Aliens, and costumes worn by Jodie Foster, Julie Andrews, Drew Barrymore, and Mike Myers in movies like The Sound of Music and Austin Powers.

properties.name: Mt. Tabor Park
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  Staff Picks: Favorite Place to be Outdoors "Take the trails, not the roads, to the top. Great view of Mt. Hood. Check out the wonderful reservoirs, the volcanic cutaway (beside the basketball courts), and on a clear day you can see Mt. St. Helens. A perfect place for sunrise and sunset." - Drew Mt. Tabor, the hill you can see up Hawthorne from the Hostel, is an extinct volcano and a great park for walks, scenic views, and riding your bike or longboard down from the top. In the park you\'ll find basketball and tennis courts, a playground, a cut-away of the hill showing the volcanic rock it\'s composed of and the soil on top, as well as three of Portland\'s reservoirs. The reservoirs were built between 1894 and 1911, and their battlements and stonework give the area sort of a medieval feel. Portland didn\'t discover that Tabor was a volcano until after they\'d already turned it into a park, and they used cinders from the volcano to pave the park\'s roads. Tabor makes Portland one of only two cities in the continental U.S. to contain an extinct volcano. (The other one, Bend, is also here in Oregon.)

properties.name: Muddy Waters
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2908 SE Belmont St, portlandStaff Picks: Favorite Coffee Shop "One of the best coffeeshop atmospheres in the area. Plus, bagels, wraps, cookies and more. Lots of books and a few games to entertain yourself, cozy couches and good music." - Kate

properties.name: Muddy's Coffeehouse
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  3560 N Mississippi Ave, Portland, OR 97227Staff Picks: Breakfast "It\'s in a beautiful old Victorian house. The owner is so friendly, you\'ll feel at home. Great daily specials, and some of the best quiche ever." - Shawn

properties.name: Nearest Bus to Downtown
properties.description: Posted by HawthornehostelTri-Met Bus #14 goes to and from downtown Portland, and passed right in front of the hostel going both ways. It\'s about 15 minutes on the bus between the hostel and downtown. When is the next bus? The stop by the hostel leading to downtown is Stop ID #2616. You can call Tri-Met Transit Tracker at 503-238-7433 and enter the Stop ID to find out when the next bus is, or click this link Plan A Trip To plan a trip on the bus to or from the hostel, click here and enter our address (3031 SE Hawthorne Blvd) and the address of where you\'re going to or coming from. Service Map

properties.name: Nearest Coffeeshop:  Chance of Rain Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  1522 SE 32nd Ave, Portland, OregonAround the corner from Hawthorne is Chance of Rain café, a favorite of both our guests and our staff. Chance of Rain is owned and operated by a half-dozen twentysomethings, and they offer organic and Fair Trade coffee, beer, organic juice, sandwiches, soups and dessert. There\'s a brunch menu on the weekends, and downtempo DJs for their special Downtempo Brunch of Sundays. The place has a really chill atmosphere, and the staff and patrons are a bunch of characters. There\'s free wifi, and it\'s the sort of place you can just hang out in for as long as you want.

properties.name: Nearest Convenience Store: Lee's Market
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel Lee\'s Market is kitty-corner to the Hostel, less than a minute\'s walk.

properties.name: Nearest Groceries: Safeway
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2800 Se Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, ORThe closest grocery store to the hostel is one block away. You could see it from the front porch, if there wasn\'t a stand of trees in the way.

properties.name: No Fish! Go Fish! and Strip Jeopardy
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3962 SE Hawthorne, Portland ORNo Fish! Go Fish! is an odd little restaurant whose specialty is sandwiches in the shape of fish, containing no fish-derived products (hence, "no fish"). HOWEVER, the real appeal of No Fish! Go Fish! is the unique event they hold every Friday night: Strip Jeopardy. Strip Jeopardy is just like real Jeopardy: Three contestants who must answer in the form of a question, a host, an audience. But in strip jeopardy, if a contestant answers a question wrong, they have to remove an article of clothing. If they fail to answer in the form of a question, they lose another article of clothing. Get a daily double, and answer right? The contestant can choose one of their competitors, who must then lose a garment. And there are also situations where the host takes off clothes, or audience members too. Strip Jeopardy starts at 10 p.m. every Friday night. And yes, people get naked. One of our hostel staff lost early when he played, and ended up sitting in front of the restaurant wearing nothing but a funny hat for 40 minutes.

properties.name: PDX International Airport
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel7000 NE Airport Way Portland ORHere\'s how to get to the hostel from the airport. By Public Transportation Buy an all-zone ticket () from a ticket machine Take the Red Line MAX light rail car (City Center & Beaverton TC) over the river to downtown Get off at Morrison/SW 3rd in downtown Walk one block east to SW 2nd and Alder Board bus #14 (Hawthorne to 94th and Foster) and show the driver your MAX ticket Get off at SE 30th and Hawthorne. We\'re across the street at the corner of 31st.By Car Exit the airport onto I-205 South Get onto I-84 West to 43rd Ave (Exit 2) Turn left at the exit ramp\'s stoplight and go to 39th Ave Turn left on 39th, which takes you over the freeway Take 39th to Hawthorne, and turn right (the corner with a Fred Meyer\'s) We\'re located on the right between 31st and 30th Avenues.

properties.name: Palio Dessert & Espresso House
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 1996 SE Ladd Ave, portlandStaff Picks: Favorite Coffee Shop "Great coffee. A good place to lounge away the hours drawing or reading. They have some of the best desserts ever, and there are plenty of games to play if you want. Open until 11 p.m." - Shawn

properties.name: Pix Patisserie
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3402 SE Division, Portland, ORStaff Picks: Breakfast "Really great desserts, of the work-of-art variety. Has a cool atmosphere at night, dim with candles. They serve beer and wine as well, and occasionally show movies."

properties.name: Portland Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2511 SE Belmont St, portlandStaff Picks: Coffee "This one is a good evening place. Many books to borrow, and a dark, comfortable interior -- couches, easy chairs, writing tables. They also have a small porch for smoking, and two computers with internet access that customers can use." - Sara

properties.name: Portland Hawthorne Hostel
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3031 SE Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OregonThere\'s nowhere in Portland that\'s more laid-back and quirky than Southeast. The Portland Hawthorne Hostel is in the middle of Southeast -- and there\'s nowhere you can stay in Portland thats more laid back and quirky than the Hawthorne Hostel.The Hostel The Hawthorne Hostel is a Victorian house built in 1909. Inside, you\'ll find that the walls are painted all different colors, there\'s mosaics on the fireplace in the dining room, and it\'s all topped off with an ecoroof, a roof covered in soil and plants to make the building more sustainable, on the second floor.Downstairs is the men\'s dorm and a coed dorm. The kitchen, dining room and office are on the ground floor with a large porch out front and an enclosed back porch with laundry facilities, lockers and bike rentals. The private rooms are on the third floor, and a room that serves as an extra coed dorm in the summer, and an extra private room in the winter. We\'re part of Hostelling International, a global non-profit organization that makes sure its hostels follow business and cleanliness standards.We throw a variety of events for visitors and the community, especially during the summer. We have a community potluck brunch every Sunday, and summer brings weekly Open Mic Nights in our yard, outdoor and \'bike in\' movies.We also feature:24 hour access, no lock-out or curfewFree wireless internet and a high speed internet kioskFree local courtesy phone; phone cards available for purchaseFree parkingFree bagels, gourmet bread and pastries DIY pancake breakfastCoffee and teaDiscount bicycle rentals onsiteLockers and laundry facilitiesOur Neighborhood The Hawthorne Hostel is located on Hawthorne Boulevard in the Sunnyside neighborhood, in the heart of Southeast Portland. Lonely Planet calls Hawthorne one of Portland\'s most youthful and dynamic neighborhoods, and with good reason. In less than ten minutes you can walk to dozens of coffeehouses, pubs, thrift stores, alternative and hippie boutique stores, ethnic and vegetarian restaurants and cafés, organic grocery stores, plus several discount movie houses, a Zen meditation center, and lots of eccentric attractions. We\'re also only a 15-minute bus ride from downtown Portland.

properties.name: Portland Memorial Mausoleum
properties.description: Posted by HawthornehostelStaff Picks: Favorite Place to Get Out of the Rain "Nothing quite like wandering around an eight story mausoleum on a rainy day. Yes, I know I\'m morbid. It\'s still neat, and impressive." - Brandon The Portland Memorial Mausoleum covers two and a half city blocks, and holds 58,000 bodies, with room for 120,000 more. Chuck Palahniuk (Fight Club) describes it as a cross between Dracula\'s castle and Nordstorms, and one of his books is set here.

properties.name: Powell's Books
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 1005 W Burnside; portland, orPowell\'s is the largest independent bookstore in the country, so large it\'s called the City of Books. It fills an entire city block between NW 10th and 11th Avenue downtown, and it\'s three stories tall. There\'s also a café inside that\'s so busy you\'ll usually have random strangers sitting down at your table with their books and their coffee, and they have free wifi.

properties.name: Powell's on Hawthorne
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel3729 Southeast Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Favorite Place to Get Out of the Rain "Of course, the old standby -- the big Powell\'s downtown -- but I like the one on Hawthorne better. It\'s more manageable and the people-watching is a little more interesting." - Talbot

properties.name: Red & Black Café
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  2138 Southeast Division Street, Portland, OR, 97202Staff Picks: Breakfast "Awesome sandwiches." - Greg The Red & Black is a worker-owned collective coffeeshop, featuring free live music and wifi, as well as food and coffee.

properties.name: Rimsky-Korsakoffee House
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel Staff Picks: Favorite Coffee Shop "A funky eccentric evening coffee and dessert spot with live instrumental music. Check out the rotating tables, the underwater bathroom and the ohhh sooo bizarre atmosphere. A little like Grandma\'s house on psychedelics." - Drew Rimsky-Korsakoffee is located in an old Victorian house. The only sign is tiny and right over the door, so it\'s easiest to find by its street number. It\'s the sort of coffeehouse where you have a waiter and you get a bill at the end, rather than one where you order at the counter. There\'s origami and random objects hanging from the ceiling on string, and \'guestbooks\' you can write in on the tables. And some of the tables, they do things you don\'t quite expect... There\'s live classical music most nights, a piano or a harp or a classic guitar. The bathroom upstairs is decorated to look like you\'re underwater, and it\'s one of a bunch of doors in a hallway with hats dangling from the ceiling. The other doors say things like, "No, not this door," and "You really better not to try to go through this door." Needless to say, it\'s quite a strange, unique place. On Friday and Saturday there\'s a minimum per person, and there\'s a + tip encouraged for the musician.

properties.name: Stark's Vacuum Cleaner Museum
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  107 Ne Grand Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: Stumptown Coffee - Belmont
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3356 SE Belmont Street, Portland, OR 97214Staff Picks: Coffee Shops "Best coffee close by. A nice walk from the hostel." - Greg

properties.name: Sunnyside Piazza
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostelse 33rd & yamhill, portland, or,The City Repair project has a program of "repairing" intersections around town, decorating them or tearing out the pavement, and installing new fixtures to try to turn public places into community spaces. Sunnyside Piazza has a huge sunflower painted in the middle of the intersection, as well as a message kiosk for neighbors to post flyers, painted rain barrels, and a solar-powered, mosaiced fountain made of cob. It\'s the nearest Intersection Repair to the Hostel, and one of the neatest.

properties.name: The Back Stage Bar
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel Staff Picks "You have to see The Back Stage to believe it. Literally the backstage of the Bagdad Theater, behind the movie screen, turned into a pub and pool hall with the same Middle Eastern theme as the rest of the Bagdad. The ceiling is seven stories above your head, through the theater\'s old catwalk system. There\'s a 20 foot by 20 foot mural on the wall that shows the space\'s history, from when it was a behind-the-scenes area of a vaudeville theatre in the \'30s to when it was an arthouse and hippie haven in the \'70s. When most people walk into The Back Stage for the first time, they seem to have trouble believing their eyes. All this, plus drinks and a jukebox with everything from Johnny Cash to Modest Mouse to Tom Waits!" - Brandon

properties.name: The Bins, the thiftiest thrift store you'll ever find
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 1740 Se Ochoco St, Milwaukie, ORThere\'s something about Portland and shopping in bulk. When we go shopping, we want ALL of our options, right there in front of us. You can see it at Powell\'s City of Books downtown, in video form at Movie Madness, and as a thrift store at The Bins. At The Bins (as people in Portland call the Goodwill Outlet Store), you pay .50 per pound of clothing you buy, and you make your selections by digging through big blue plastic bins full of unsorted clothing. The bins are on wheels, and every so often one of the old bins gets pulled out and a new one gets wheeled in from elsewhere in the building. If you\'re patient, you can discover some incredible things... or a whole bunch of crap, depending on the day.

properties.name: The Doug Fir Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 830 East Burnside Street, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Places To Go Out At Night "Great bands, close by." - Greg

properties.name: The Fresh Pot (inside Powell's Books Hawthorne)
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3729 Southeast Hawthorne Boulevard, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Best Coffee Shop "Both locations (on Hawthorne and at the main Powell\'s downtown) are great for checking out books you have pulled off the shelves and sitting back and people-watching." - Emily (They also sell Voodoo Doughnuts!)

properties.name: The Good Foot Pub & Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2845 SE Stark St. Portland, OR 97214Staff Picks: Place To Go Out At Night "The most fun on Friday nights. DJs spin old-school hip-hop n\' funk with breakdancers and they have great beer, artwork and bands to boot!" - Talbot

properties.name: The Montage
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 301 Se Morrison St, Portland, ORLocated under the Morrison Bridge, the Montage is a late-night dining experience. You may love it or you may hate it, but you aren\'t likely to be ambivalent about it. Here\'s Brandon\'s first experience with the Montage: "I was taken aback by how classy and fancy it looked when I walked in. Then one of the cooks bellowed \'WHAAAAAAZUUUUUP!\' because he saw new people in the restaurant. "And then I looked down, and saw bits of paper all over the floor. All of the day\'s bills, scattered all over the floor. "And then there was the fact that, when we ordered the Green Eggs and Spam, they made it using 17 eggs, for no apparent reason. As the waiter delivered it, he knocked my water glass into my lap, which it fell out of and shattered without getting anything more than my knees wet. "The waiter was also wearing shorts, and had patches all over his apron -- like, patches in the shape of flowers or something. "When we left, the staff wrapped the leftovers into a doggy bag in the shape of a squirrel made of tinfoil. "I will, from henceforth, be bringing EVERYONE who comes to visit me in Portland to Montage."

properties.name: The Night Light Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2100 SE Clinton st, portlandStaff Picks: Places To Go Out At Night "Inside is illuminated by candlelight. This loung is always a good place for beer and conversation." - Emily

properties.name: The Pied Cow
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3244 SE Belmont St portland oregonStaff Picks: Place To Go Out At Night "Smoke a hookah while enjoying one of their 30 beers or numerous wines." - Drew The Pied Cow is a coffeehouse, wine bar, and hookah bar in a historic house on Belmont. Inside, the place looks like an opium den (or how one would imagine an opium den would look, if one hasn\'t been on the Portland Underground Tour) -- lush, extravagant, incredibly atmospheric.

properties.name: The Shop on Belmont
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2511 SE Belmont, portland

properties.name: The Tao of Tea
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 3430 Southeast Belmont Street, Portland, OR, 97214Staff Picks: Best Place to Get Out of the Rain "A quiet, meditative and relaxing place to spend an afternoon trying a huge selection of gourmet teas in a Japanese garden-ish atmosphere. Take a good book. Nice menu with an amazing smoked vanilla ice cream." - Drew

properties.name: The Vern
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 2622 SE Belmont st, portlandStaff Picks: Place To Go Out At Night "Look for the tavern with the broken \'ta\'. Pretty divey, but every night they have beer specials on good beer! Plus free pool, foosball and pinball." - Kate

properties.name: Toney Bento
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 1423 SE 37th Ave, portlandStaff Picks: Dinner Place "Sushi, bento, salads, pot stickers, miso, something or everyone. Good prices, cool atmosphere." - Kate

properties.name: Union Station - Portland's Amtrak
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel800 Nw 6th Ave, Portland, ORHere\'s how to get to the Hostel from Union Station, Portland\'s Amtrak station. Walk one block south on NW 6th Ave to NW Hoyt St Take a right on Hoyt and walk one block west to NW Broadway. Board Bus #9 (Powell), pay .70 and grab a bus transfer Get off at SW 3rd and Alder Cross SW 3rd and walk one block east to SW 2nd and Alder Use your transfer to take Bus #14 (Hawthorne to 94th and Foster) to SE 30th and Hawthorne, one stop past the Safeway on the right Get off at 30th, and walk across the street to 3031 SE Hawthorne (If you don\'t mind walking a 15 minute walk, you can skip bus #9 and just walk down to the 2nd and Alder stop for the #14.)

properties.name: Veganopolis
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  412 Sw 4th Ave, Portland, ORStaff Picks: Dinner Place "Downtown, so if you\'re headed that way and want some great sandwiches and smiling waitstaff, this is a good pick. They close early (at 6 p.m.), so go for a late lunch. Their specials are always spectacular!" - Emily

properties.name: Velveteria:  The Velvet Painting Museum
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  518 NE 28th Ave, portland, orA visit to Dot\'s or Red Light got you interested in the fine art of kitsch velvet paintings? Velveteria is an entire museum devoted to them. "Velvet painting is the Rodney Dangerfield of art. It\'s the stuff nobody wanted like a red headed step-child. But that\'s wrong. Velvet painting is technically difficult and requires different skills than ordinary painting. Our pieces range from fine art to \'Oh my God, what were they thinking?\' With over 170 painting on display, there is something for everyone. "Velveteria takes one through the South Sea islands to a lair of beautiful ladies to the Wall of Fame where the classics of velvet are found. Dogs playing poker, Elvis, Banditos and clowns. Plus, we have rotating shows, like the story of Jesus and Mary on velvet, during April for Easter. Velvet painting captures pathos and whimsy in a frame. "

properties.name: Voodoo Doughnuts
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel  22 SW 3rd Ave, portland, orEver had a donut covered in M&Ms? Or Oreo cookies? Or Froot Loops? Or a donut shaped like the male genitalia? Voodoo Doughnuts is one of the Portland\'s signature eateries, a donut shop open 24 hours a day, serving a bizarre variety of improbable pastries.

properties.name: Watertrough Saloon
properties.description: Posted by Hawthornehostel 4815 SE Hawthorne Blvd, portlandStaff Picks: Place to go at Night "Its a tie between this place and The Vern for my favorite place to have a beer/play some pool. They both have good jukeboxes -- the Vern\'s tends more towards punk, with more of a hipster crowd. The Watertrough is a quieter place, lots of room to move and regulars." - Sara
